duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform observations of animal colonies for signs of illness and follow up on animals reported ill on Animal Health Reports.
Administer necessary medications or treatments as prescribed by the veterinarian and maintain current animal health reports, treatment, and follow-up records.
Conduct certain veterinary diagnostic procedures under the guidance of the Clinical Veterinarian and assist with preventive medicine and collection of diagnostic samples.
Maintain records of controlled and non-controlled substances in accordance with federal and state regulations.
Prepare and administer analgesia/anesthesia drugs commonly used in research settings based on the approved written IACUC protocols.
Facilitate teaching activities and demonstrate techniques or procedures while maintaining official documentation for regulatory compliance.
Maintain sanitized, well-stocked, and organized procedure rooms, necropsy room, and surgical suite, including preparing surgical packs and troubleshooting anesthetic machines.
Inform the facility users of discrepancies in the animal colonies as reported by the animal census system.
Respond to urgent animal welfare or health concerns during normal working hours and document the usage of procedural space, anesthetic equipment, and other CCM instruments/tools.
Follow established City of Hope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, environmental, and infection control guidelines.
Practice a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.

education_certification.credential: Completion of AVMA accredited Animal Health Technician program or a B.S (preferably in Animal Science or a biological science). At least 3 months of experience in working as a veterinary assistant or technician in clinical settings or as part of RVT training required.
Current California Registered Veterinarian Technician license (or obtain within 6 months of hire).
